sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the products of the following reaction: FeCl3 + KSCN? And what type of reaction is it?
message_2:
The reaction between FeCl3 (Iron(III) chloride) and KSCN (Potassium thiocyanate) is a double displacement reaction, also known as a metathesis reaction. In this reaction, the anions (Cl- and SCN-) will exchange places, resulting in the formation of new products.

The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

FeCl3 (aq) + 3 KSCN (aq) â†’ Fe(SCN)3 (aq) + 3 KCl (aq)

The products of this reaction are Fe(SCN)3 (Iron(III) thiocyanate) and KCl (Potassium chloride).
